item.title: My setup
item.description:
This post will list my current computer setup and software I use. It will be continously updated, instead of creating new versions of this post.

Software

I usually lean towards Free and Open Source Software, but if there's no good alternative to a propriatary counterpart, I go with whatever gets the job done without too much hassle. I like to keep things minimal and avoid wasting time on unnecessary setups. Automating repetitive tasks is my go-to; I’d rather skip the GUIs and streamline the process.

Generic

  • Text editor: Emacs
  • Notes: Emacs+denote.el
  • Browsers: Firefox, Brave with:
    • uBlock Origin
    • Imagus
  • Image Editor: GIMP
  • Video Player: mpv
  • Torrent Client: qBittorrent
  • Terminal Emulator: Alacritty
  • Terminal File Manager: Yazi

Linux specific

  • Shell: Zsh with some plugins:
    • Fast Syntax Highlighting
    • Autosuggestions
  • Music player: mpd+ncmpcpp
  • Window Management: Hyprland

Windows specific

  • Shell: PowerShell
  • Music Player: MusicBee
  • Window Management: komorebi

Android Specific

  • Terminal: Termux
  • Window Management: i3+Termux X11
  • Music Player: Black Player EX

Hardware

I don’t need anything fancy, but I also don’t cut corners just to save a few bucks. The current hardware I use is just enough to get the job done. I do some light gaming on a daily basis and occasionally fire up something heavier, but my focus is mainly on the story, not the visuals.

Tower PC

  • CPU: AMD Ryzen 5 3600
  • GPU: Gainward NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970
  • RAM: 16 GB DDR4 3200 MHz
  • Drive 1: Samsung SSD 980 500GB M.2
  • Drive 2: Generic 1TB Sata
  • Monitor: Samsung Odyssey G5 27" QHD 144Hz
  • OS: Windows 10 IoT Enterprise LTSC

Laptop

MSI Bravo 15 b5dd

  • CPU: AMD Ryzen 5 3600H
  • GPU: AMD Radeon RX 5500M with 4GB GDDR6
  • RAM: 8 GB DDR4 3200 MHz
  • Drive: Samsung SSD 990 2TB M.2
  • Screen: 15.6" FHD 144Hz
  • OS: Nobara 40

Peripherals

  • Keyboard: Cheapino v2 split keyboard with:
    • Matcha XDA Keycaps
    • Colemak-DH Layout
  • Mouse: Steelseries Rival 3
  • Microphone: Blue Yeti Blackout Edition

Phone

Xiaomi Redmi Note 10 Pro with AwakenOS custom rom. I mostly use apps from F-Droid store, but if I need anything from Google Play Store, like a banking app, I use Aurora Store. Here are some apps I use and recommend:

  • Aniyomi: Full-featured player and reader for anime and manga.
  • Breezy Weather: A material design weather application.
  • Chromite: Based, privacy first chrome fork for android.
  • Droid-ify: Better, material design f-droid app.
  • Fossify Apps: Degoogled base apps.
    • Fossify Contacts
    • Fossify Gallery
    • Fossify Messages
    • Fossify Phone
  • FUTO Keyboard: Modern keyboard that respects your privacy and security.
  • KeePassDX: Best KeePass client for android.
  • Librera Reader: Simple eBook reader.
  • Material Files: Material design file manager with support for network file systems.
